parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Trans: I bring near; intrans: I come near, approach. From eggus; to make near, i.e. approach.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A village, country town. From keimai; a hamlet.
Where, whither, when, in what place. Genitive case of hos as adverb; at which place, i.e. Where.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Plural
Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To pretend, regard, make a show of. Middle voice from pros and poieo; to do forward for oneself, i.e. Pretend.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive

str2: Far, far off, at a distance. Adverb from pro; forwards, i.e. At a distance.
